description: A steel flash hider that attaches at the muzzle.  A standard muzzle device for U.S. military rifles.

variants.description: A steel flash hider that mounts onto the threading at the muzzle.  Its primary function is to reduce muzzle flash.  This is the baseline muzzle device for Army-issued AR-15-platform rifles.  <variant:black>

//integral_longest_side: absorbs 16 mm of regular threading on a 1/2 in. × 24-threaded barrel
//handling_modifier: in the muzzle brake shootout, the A2 scored 1.06% recoil reduction compared to a bare muzzle, which doesn't even come close to dedicated muzzle brakes
however, in the muzzle device shootout, it scored 8.08%, which is respectable for a flash hider
we assume the latter to be more-accurate, since A2 is expected to perform as both a flash hider and a compensator
//price: Truth About Guns review lists A2 MSRP as $9.00 at the time
we list the most modern price at the time of creating the item
worth noting that competitor/copycat designs often have prices between $8.00 and $10.00
Charlie's Clones lists their A2 as $16.99

description: A steel flash hider that attaches at the muzzle.  Primarily serves as a mounting point for the army suppressor.

variants.description: A steel flash hider that mounts onto the threading at the muzzle.  While its primary function is to reduce muzzle flash, this model also serves as a mount for the KAC QDSS suppressor.  <variant:black>

//integral_longest_side: absorbs 16 mm of regular threading on a 1/2 in. × 24-threaded barrel
//handling_modifier: we presume that, like the A2 birdcage, this flash hider has a compensator effect to it
the value for the modifier is copied from the A2, given their similar patterns of upwards gas redirection
